title: Survivors of Sungkai plane crash identified
summary: The flight instructor and trainee of the Cessna 172 (9M ADA) type training aircraft which crashed in an oil palm plantation in Besout 2 Tambahan plantation, Sungkai near here have been identified as Captain Shahrul Imran Surea, 26, and Ho Jia Lee, 20.
content:
IPOH (May 4): The flight instructor and trainee of the Cessna 172 (9M ADA) type training aircraft which crashed in an oil palm plantation in Besout 2 Tambahan plantation, Sungkai near here have been identified as Captain Shahrul Imran Surea, 26, and Ho Jia Lee, 20.

Perak police chief Datuk Seri Mohd Yusri Hassan Basri said Shahrul Imran, who lives in Jalan Jelatek Kuala Lumpur, is suspected of having a broken right leg, while Ho, who lives in Lahat Perak, has swelling on the right side of her face.

title: CAAM confirms Cessna 172N Skyhawk aircraft crashed near Felda Gunung Besout
summary: The Civil Aviation Authority of Malaysia (CAAM) has confirmed that a Cessna 172N Skyhawk aircraft with the registration number 9M-ADA crashed near Felda Gunung Besout, Sungkai, Perak on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 4): The Civil Aviation Authority of Malaysia (CAAM) has confirmed that a Cessna 172N Skyhawk aircraft with the registration number 9M-ADA crashed near Felda Gunung Besout, Sungkai, Perak on Saturday.

The plane, with two survivors onboard and operated by Layang Layang Flying Academy, took off from Sultan Azlan Shah Airport, Ipoh, at 7.54am, and the Kuala Lumpur Air Traffic Control Centre (KLATCC) received its last transmission over Slim River at 9.35am.

title: Melaka aims to boost local businesses, eyes more listings on Bursa Malaysia
summary: The Melaka state government is setting its sights on bolstering its local business landscape by encouraging more companies in the state to be listed on Bursa Malaysia.
content:
MELAKA (May 4): The Melaka state government is setting its sights on bolstering its local business landscape by encouraging more companies in the state to be listed on Bursa Malaysia.

Deputy Exco of Economic Planning, Finance, Land Affairs, Non-Governmental Agencies, Investment, Industrial and Technical and Vocational Development (TVET), Datuk Khaidhirah Abu Zahar, said that currently, only 23 local companies in the state are public-listed companies (PLCs).

title: Loke: Govt studying Ocean Infinity's proposal to resume search for MH370
summary: The government is currently studying the proposal from marine robotics company Ocean Infinity to resume the search for Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370, which went missing while en route to Beijing 10 years ago.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 4): The government is currently studying the proposal from marine robotics company Ocean Infinity to resume the search for Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370, which went missing while en route to Beijing 10 years ago.

Transport Minister Anthony Loke said that based on discussions held on Thursday, the company had submitted a proposal paper along with evidence and information for examination by the relevant parties under his ministry.

He said that

title: Progress of ECRL project in four states reaches 65%, says Loke
summary: Construction work on the East Coast Rail Link (ECRL) project in Kelantan, Terengganu, Pahang and Selangor has reached an average of 65% as of April, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 4): Construction work on the East Coast Rail Link (ECRL) project in Kelantan, Terengganu, Pahang and Selangor has reached an average of 65% as of April, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke.

He said that in Selangor, particularly, the project has progressed by more than 26% up to last month, in line with the schedule for the preparation of the ECRL line from Gombak to Port Klang in December 2027, with operations set to begin in January 2028.

“

title: Light aircraft crashes in Sungkai, two passengers survive
summary: A training aircraft crashed in the Besout 2 Tambahan plantation area in Sungkai on Saturday.
content:
IPOH (May 4): A training aircraft crashed in the Besout 2 Tambahan plantation area in Sungkai on Saturday.

Perak police chief Datuk Seri Mohd Yusri Hassan Basri, when contacted, confirmed the incident.

“Yes, it was a training aircraft, and the passengers survived,” he said.

He said there were two passengers, a man and a woman, onboard the aircraft when the incident oc

title: Malaysia's press freedom index position is still good, says Fahmi
summary: Malaysia's latest position in the Press Freedom Index is still considered good compared to the previous government, said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.
content:
GEORGE TOWN (May 4): Malaysia's latest position in the Press Freedom Index is still considered good compared to the previous government, said Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil.

He said that although Malaysia was ranked 107th based on the 2024 World Press Freedom Index Report published by Reporters Without Borders (RSF) on Friday, the position was not that bad.

"Being at 107 (in the Press Freedom Index), that for me is still an unsatisfactory achievement, but

title: KKB polls: Parties, candidates redoubling efforts as campaign enters critical period
summary: The Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) by-election campaign is entering a critical period for all contesting parties and candidates to redouble their efforts to win as many votes as possible.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 4): The Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) by-election campaign is entering a critical period for all contesting parties and candidates to redouble their efforts to win as many votes as possible.

With seven days left before the May 11 poll, the KKB by-election campaign picks up pace with the flag war of the contesting parties, except for the Independent candidate, in several locations around the constituency.

title: Michelle Yeoh receives Presidential Medal of Freedom from Biden
summary: Hollywood superstar and acclaimed Malaysian actress Tan Sri Michelle Yeoh has received the prestigious Presidential Medal of Freedom from US President Joe Biden on Friday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 4): Hollywood superstar and acclaimed Malaysian actress Tan Sri Michelle Yeoh has received the prestigious Presidential Medal of Freedom from US President Joe Biden on Friday.

The ceremony, held at the White House on Friday night local time or Saturday morning in Malaysia, marked a historic moment as Yeoh became the first Asian actress to receive this esteemed recognition.

title: The Week Ahead: All eyes on Bank Negara’s monetary policy meeting, Xi’s three-nation European trip
summary: Will Bank Negara Malaysia’s Monetary Policy Committee follow its Indonesian counterparts by raising interest rates when it holds its next meeting on Wednesday and Thursday?
content:
Will Bank Negara Malaysia’s Monetary Policy Committee follow its Indonesian counterparts by raising interest rates when it holds its next meeting on Wednesday and Thursday?

title: HLIB Research maintains 'neutral' call on banking sector
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Hong Leong Investment Bank (HLIB) Research is keeping its 'neutral' rating on the local banking sector, citing a more balanced risk-reward scenario due to the absence of fresh catalysts to drive share prices notably higher.It said that ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Hong Leong Investment Bank (HLIB) Research is keeping its 'neutral' rating on the local banking sector, citing a more balanced risk-reward scenario due to the absence of fresh catalysts to drive share prices notably higher.

It said that the projected banking sector's profit growth for the fiscal years 2024/2025 is slower at 6.0 per cent and 4.0 per cent respectively, compared to 15 per cent in the previous year.

This lags behind the broader market's expected 7.0 per cent rise in the curre

title: F&N to allocate RM1.7bil capex for Negri Sembilan dairy farm
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd plans to set aside RM1.7 billion in capital expenditure for its integrated dairy farm called F&N AgriValley in Gemas, Negri Sembilan.F&N had completed the social impact study of ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd plans to set aside RM1.7 billion in capital expenditure for its integrated dairy farm called F&N AgriValley in Gemas, Negri Sembilan.

F&N had completed the social impact study of the project, with land clearance and site preparation of the dairy barn site near completion, according to its chief executive officer Lim Yew Hoe.

The company had also selected the first batch of dairy cattle on schedule to meet the farm's first milking target date of early 2025, Lim tol

title: Retailers fear current weakness in consumer spending
summary: Retail sales typically slow in the second quarter of the year as consumers take a breather from spending after the festivities in the first quarter. As such, when retailers say their sales fell short of expectations during the two major festive periods so far this year, it is time to pay attention.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 4): Retail sales typically slow in the second quarter of the year as consumers take a breather from spending after the festivities in the first quarter. As such, when retailers say their sales fell short of expectations during the two major festive periods so far this year, it is time to pay attention.

Ordinarily, following the lull in the second quarter, the cycle then picks up in the third and continues until it peaks in the fourth, when retailers hope to end the year stronger than the prev

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Elevated rates cloud small caps outlook
summary: The prospect of interest rates remaining elevated as the Federal Reserve battles inflation is further clouding the outlook for shares of smaller US companies, which have lagged broader markets this year.
content:
Stubbornly strong inflation has eroded prospects of rate cuts this year, and small cap stocks have suffered as a result.

NEW YORK: The prospect of interest rates remaining elevated as the Federal Reserve battles inflation is further clouding the outlook for shares of smaller US companies, which have lagged broader markets this year.

title: Wall St ends higher, jobs data beef up case for rate cuts
summary: Wall Street surged to a higher close on Friday as a softer-than-expected employment report bolstered the case for rate cuts from the Federal Reserve while also providing evidence of US economic resilience.
content:
The Dow rose 450.02 points, or 1.18%, to 38,675.68, the S&P 500 gained 63.59 points, or 1.26%, to 5,127.79 and the Nasdaq added 315.37 points, or 1.99%, to 16,156.33.

title: Oil records steepest weekly loss in 3 months
summary: Oil prices settled lower on Friday, and posted their steepest weekly loss in three months as investors weighed weak US jobs data and possible timing of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut.
content:
Brent crude futures for July settled 71 cents lower, or 0.85%, to US$82.96 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude for June fell 84 cents, or 1.06%, to US$78.11 a barrel.

NEW YORK: Oil prices settled lower on Friday, and posted their steepest weekly loss in three months as investors weighed weak US jobs data and possible timing of a Federal Reserve interest rate cut.

title: Civil servants salary hike achievable through prudent financial management — Anwar
summary:
Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has given the assurance that salary increase for civil servants starting this December, as announced two days ago, can be implemented through strict financial management.

Anwar, who is also Finance Minister, said the projected salary adjustment, estimated to cost over RM10 billion from next year onward, is feasible with disciplined financial oversight.
content:
KANGAR (May 3): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has given the assurance that salary increase for civil servants starting this December, as announced two days ago, can be implemented through strict financial management.

Anwar, who is also Finance Minister, said the projected salary adjustment, estimated to cost over RM10 billion from next year onward, is feasible with disciplined financial oversight.

title: Master AI to shape own moral values, cultural impact in technology — PM
summary:
Mastering Artificial Intelligence (AI) is crucial to ensure Malaysians themselves determine the cultural and moral values within this technology.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said if AI is not mastered, the values and morals embedded in it will be determined by those who control the technology, particularly from Western countries.
content:
KANGAR (May 3): Mastering Artificial Intelligence (AI) is crucial to ensure Malaysians themselves determine the cultural and moral values within this technology.

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said if AI is not mastered, the values and morals embedded in it will be determined by those who control the technology, particularly from Western countries.

title: KKB polls: PH candidate unveils five-point manifesto
summary:
Pakatan Harapan (PH) candidate Pang Sock Tao has unveiled a five-pronged manifesto for the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) state by-election.

Themed 'Kekal Kuala Kubu', the manifesto focuses on economic aspects; facilities; environment and recreation; heritage and culture; and the people's well-being.
content:
HULU SELANGOR (May 3): Pakatan Harapan (PH) candidate Pang Sock Tao has unveiled a five-pronged manifesto for the Kuala Kubu Baharu (KKB) state by-election.

Themed 'Kekal Kuala Kubu', the manifesto focuses on economic aspects; facilities; environment and recreation; heritage and culture; and the people's well-being.

title: Onn Hafiz hopes Johoreans living elsewhere can come back and contribute ideas to develop the state
summary:
Johor Menteri Besar Datuk Onn Hafiz Ghazi hopes more Johoreans living outside Johor will return to the state and contribute ideas to ensure progress and development in the state that they were born in.

According to Onn Hafiz, the state government has initiated efforts to attract Johoreans who have progressed in their professional careers to come back and serve the state in efforts to turn Johor into developed status.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (May 3): Johor Menteri Besar Datuk Onn Hafiz Ghazi hopes more Johoreans living outside Johor will return to the state and contribute ideas to ensure progress and development in the state that they were born in.

title: MJets Air inks aircraft charter agreement with Teleport Everywhere
summary:
MJets Air Sdn Bhd has entered into an aircraft charter agreement with Teleport Everywhere Pte Ltd (Singapore).

MJets Air is the commercial air cargo operator of MMAG Aviation Consortium Sdn Bhd, under the umbrella of MMAG Holdings Bhd, while Teleport, which caters to Teleport Commerce Malaysia Sdn Bhd, is an integrated logistics solutions provider and logistics venture of Capital A Bhd.

MJets Air is the commercial air cargo operator of MMAG Aviation Consortium Sdn Bhd, under the umbrella of MMAG Holdings Bhd, while Teleport, which caters to Teleport Commerce Malaysia Sdn Bhd, is an integrated logistics solutions provider and logistics venture of Capital A Bhd.

title: Congestion at Port Klang see ships taking up to nine hours to dock [NSTTV]
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: Ships are taking up to an average of nine hours to dock at Port Klang terminals, as Westports and Northport see a sudden surge in number of vessels re-routed due to the ongoing Red Sea crisis.Port Klang ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: Ships are taking up to an average of nine hours to dock at Port Klang terminals, as Westports and Northport see a sudden surge in number of vessels re-routed due to the ongoing Red Sea crisis.

Port Klang Authority (PKA) general manager Captain K. Subramaniam told Business Times, as of April 2024, the average berthing delay (ATA) for container vessels at Westports is 9.3 hours and at Northport, it is 1.9 hours.

Port Klang is facing vessel bunching due to the high number of vessels calling out of window.

Port Klang is facing vessel bunching due to the high number of vessels calling out of window.

title: Changing office space requirements
summary: The United States commercial real estate sector still paints a gloomy picture, as it is finding it hard to shake off the troubles the Covid-19 pandemic left in its wake nearly four years ago.
content:
THE United States commercial real estate sector still paints a gloomy picture, as it is finding it hard to shake off the troubles the Covid-19 pandemic left in its wake nearly four years ago.

Many office properties in the United States are facing an uncertain future, with some reports going as far as to suggest that the sector is entering a crisis point.

title: Demand for co-working space remains resilient
summary: The office market went through a significant change after Covid-19 struck in 2019, leading to the popularity and growth of flexible offices, or famously known as co-working spaces.
content:
Teh: The market is far from saturated in our view, as the total take-up rate of space accounts for less than 2% of the total office stock.

THE office market went through a significant change after Covid-19 struck in 2019, leading to the popularity and growth of flexible offices, or famously known as co-working spaces.

title: Yew Lee expects to return to profitability on wider customer base
summary: Good strategies will take time to materialise. That’s how Yew Lee Pacific Group Bhd founder and managing director Ang Lee Leong sees it, as he shares his plans to turn the loss-making company around.
content:

title: Caring for an ageing population
summary: The concern across the Asia-Pacific region is the risk that communities will grow old before they amass sufficient resources to adequately support their golden years.
content:
THE concern across the Asia-Pacific region is the risk that communities will grow old before they amass sufficient resources to adequately support their golden years.

In 2022, there were 13.5% older people among the regional population and for those aged 60 and above, the figure will nearly double to 25.2% by 2050.

title: Protecting trade is protecting yourself
summary: Unlike 2016, it was almost taken for granted that free trade is good for everyone.
content:
The IMF has estimated that increasing fragmentation of global trade may cost the world up to 7% of GDP over the long term. — Bloomberg

UNLIKE 2016, it was almost taken for granted that free trade is good for everyone.

That was before Donald Trump started the tariff war on Chinese imports, which his successor Joe Biden turbocharged with even more sanctions against individuals, companies and countries.

title: Rents for luxury homes in Singapore jump in 1Q amid wider slump
summary: Rents for large luxury homes in Singapore jumped in the first quarter of of 2024 (1Q24), in contrast to an overall slump in the wider market, as demand from high-net-worth foreigners met with limited supply, say real estate agents.
content:
Rents for high-end four-bedroom luxury homes rose 6.5% in the first quarter to an average of US$17,467 a month. — The Straits Times

RENTS for large luxury homes in Singapore jumped in the first quarter of of 2024 (1Q24), in contrast to an overall slump in the wider market, as demand from high-net-worth foreigners met with limited supply, say real estate agents.

summary: As we are into the month of May, a slew of companies with financial year ended Dec 31, 2023, will be having their respective AGM over the next few weeks and right to the end of June 2024, where the statutory window closes.
content:

title: Talking more but saying less on rates is smart
summary: It's the policy habit that’s proving tough to kick. Despite easy caricatures of central bankers as cautious and dry folks, they have developed a tendency to overshare.
content:
